title: 103_hr1860
content:
The Act titled "Combined Welfare Administration Act of 1993" includes a combined grant to states for administrative costs of AFDC, Medicaid, and Food Stamp programs. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will provide grants to each State for the administration of State plans for aid to families with dependent children, medical assistance, and food stamps. Grants will be funded through appropriations or funds from the Social Security Act or the Food Stamp Act of 1977. The Secretary of Agriculture will establish a single fund account for the administration of the Act by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Elimination of enhanced federal payments for state administrative activities under AFDC, Medicaid, and food stamps. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Social Security Act regarding AFDC and Medicaid, including changes to the amount allocated to states for administration. The text chunk outlines amendments to the Social Security Act related to AFDC and Medicaid, including changes to state plan requirements and claims processing systems. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to subsections related to AFDC and Medicaid, such as updating paragraph references and striking certain subsections. Amendments to the Food Stamp Program involve changes to section 16(a) of the Food Stamp Act of 1977, including conforming amendments to section 16(c)(1) of the Act. Amendments to section 16(c) of the Food Stamp Act of 1977 involve changes to incentive payments and claims procedures. Subparagraphs are renumbered and references to specific paragraphs are updated. Amendments to the Food Stamp Act of 1977 involve changes to specific sections, including renumbering subparagraphs and updating references. Amendments to the Food Stamp Act of 1977 involve changes to specific sections, including renumbering subparagraphs and updating references. Section 4 addresses the allotment and payment of funds under the grant program. The total amount payable to a State under the Act for fiscal year 1994 is based on administrative amounts from the last two quarters of fiscal year 1993 and the first two quarters of fiscal year 1994. Subsequent years' payments increase based on the consumer price index. Payments under this section are based on the consumer price index for urban consumers for the 12-month period ending in June of the previous year. The allowable administrative amounts defined are the amounts payable to a State for specified quarters. The sum payable to a State for a specified quarter includes payments under various sections of the Social Security Act and the Food Stamp Act of 1977, excluding certain amounts and activities. The sum payable to a State for a specified quarter includes payments under different sections of the Social Security Act and the Food Stamp Act of 1977, with limitations on State expenditures considered only if funds have been transferred for administrative costs under specific titles of the Acts. The Secretary will apply the Acts as if the amendments made by them do not enhance administrative payments in determining grant amounts. The Stamp Act of 1977 amendments made by section 3 are treated as if they were in effect for quarters starting in 1993. In case of a dispute between a State and the Secretary regarding a payment claim affecting the State's allotment, the disputed amount will not be included in allotments until the dispute is resolved. SEC. 5. REPORT ON INTENDED USE OF FUNDS AND ACTIVITIES; AUDIT. Each State must prepare a report detailing the intended use of funds received under the grant, including goals and administrative expenditures. The report should also address fiscal control measures and provide an overview of the State's activities in the previous fiscal year. It must be made public for review and comments within the State. Each State receiving a grant under this Act must conduct biennial financial and compliance audits of its expenditures. Audits must be done independently and in accordance with auditing standards. Audit reports must be made available for public inspection within the State. SEC. 6. INAPPLICABILITY OF SINGLE STATE AGENCY REQUIREMENTS UNDER OTHER ACTS. A State plan approved under various Acts shall not fail to comply solely because the administering agency is different. SEC. 7. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. (a) AFDC.--Section 403(a)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to include exceptions for payments made to the State under the Combined Welfare Administration Act of 1993.
(b) Medicaid.--Section 1903(a)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to include exceptions for payments made to the State under the Combined Welfare Administration Act of 1993.
(c) Food Stamp Program.--Section 16 of the Food Stamp Act of 1977 is amended to reduce payments to a State if payments are made under certain circumstances. Payments to the State under the Combined Welfare Administration Act of 1993 will reduce the amount allocated for activities in the fiscal year. The Act defines the terms "Secretary" and "State" and specifies that it applies to payments to States under certain acts for quarters in fiscal years after 1993.
